modules.title: Project Info
paragraph: As a standard part of many interviews, I was presented with a Coding Challenge by a company that I interviewed with. They provided a link to a Figma design, as well as a few additional requirements.

Some standard 'Dos and Donts' included not using a CSS framework and of course, making sure the page is responsive. This requires a little prior knowledge and ability to create responsive websites on your own, as the Figma file doesn't provide any small screen design.

This was a great challenge that I was excited to tackle head on. I had a complete design in front of me to work from, but with some of their requirements, I had the freedom to make some of my own decisions with how to set up the page.
For a detailed look at the Project Summary, feel free to check out this document I wrote up at the conclusion of the challenge.
